intro: Psittacanthus plumieri, commonly known as the Brazilian pineapple or golden star fern, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive golden-yellow coloration on the underside, giving it its common name. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its striking appearance. Psittacanthus plumieri thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
